means: 使成一线( align的过去式和过去分词 )
公开支持（某人、集体或观点）

sentence.Network_en: Make sure the shelf is aligned with the top of the cupboard.
sentence.Network_cn: 务必使搁架与橱柜顶端对齐。

sentence.Network_en: The senator aligned himself with the critics of the proposed reforms.
sentence.Network_cn: 这位参议员公开支持对拟议的改革提出批评的人.

sentence.Network_en: Keep the rough edge of the fabric aligned with the raw edge of the piping.
sentence.Network_cn: 将织物的毛边与滚边未经加工的边对齐。

entry.def: If you align yourself with a particular group, you support them because you have the same political aim.

example.ex: There are signs that the prime minister is aligning himself with the liberals...
example.tran: 有迹象表明首相正在与自由党人结盟。

example.ex: He has attempted to align the Socialists with the environmental movement.
example.tran: 他已试图争取社会党人支持环境运动。

entry.def: If you align something, you place it in a certain position in relation to something else, usually parallel to it.

example.ex: A tripod will be useful to align and steady the camera...
example.tran: 三脚架有助于调准和稳定相机。

example.ex: Keep the rough edge of the fabric aligned with the raw edge of the piping.
example.tran: 将织物的毛边与滚边未经加工的边对齐。

means.word_mean: 1. brought into agreement or cooperation on the side of a faction, party, or cause
